messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2931/brrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr
messages.msgSnippet: Yeah, how about -10.     Let s say we are getting really good at run to the store, run to the van,  run to the house, run to the van.      There s our
messages.messageBody:
Yeah,

how about -10. Let's say we are getting really good at run to the store, run to the van, run to the house, run to the van. There's our exercise,

Sandra, I hope it warms up for you, as far as Cananda goes. I'm thinking I would go into shock going from New Mexico to Saskachewan! My thoughts are with you for the coldness and the school-at-homers!

Kelli, brrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr


DanickeHouse <saremca@...> wrote:<<We lived in Michigan a few years ago and would drive down to Toledo. The
kids loved the ball "cannon" and I was crazy about the "mid-air bike". One
of the few things I miss about that cold, cold place>>

Yeah, very cold. Like 12 degrees right now. Too cold for me to venture
outside. Even for COSI.

Liz (in a suburb of Toledo)
saremca@...
Age doesn't always bring wisdom, sometimes age comes alone.

saremca@... writes:


>
> Yeah, very cold. Like 12 degrees right now. Too cold for me to venture
> outside. Even for COSI.
>

Where are you, Liz? We're in West Toledo. The weather man is predicting 2
days of 30's next week, then 10 more days of frigid temps.
Amy Kagey

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2931
messages.msgSnippet: Isn t that the coolest place? We lived in Michigan a few years ago and would drive down to Toledo.  The kids loved
messages.messageBody:
<<And the kids always want to go to COSI>>

Isn't that the coolest place?

We lived in Michigan a few years ago and would drive down to Toledo. The
kids loved the ball "cannon" and I was crazy about the "mid-air bike". One
of the few things I miss about that cold, cold place.

Julie in Texas
